Author: nanijoe
Content: This article should have been published in the National Enquirer. I can't think of any other demographic that would fall for the crap this guy is trying to sell.

Author: mynameishere
Content: Deer always seemed constantly petrified to me, but maybe that was because I only saw them at times when I happened to be near.

Author: Zak
Content: I suppose it depends on how groundbreaking your project is. A lot of web apps are mostly glue code and presentation, making libraries more important than language features. If you're solving more interesting problems, your ability to write new code will be more important.

Author: gscott
Content:
It seems like you might want to use Ruby on Rails because you can "describe" what you want to do and Rails will make the basic pages and database tables.

From what you are describing, what you are looking to do is very simple. There are probably examples that encompass most of the functionality you want to make. Look here for lots of free examples: http://www.codango.com/

Author: alanmccann
Content:
"robust Group featureset. Public and Private groups, each with a fairly large list of information."

It's unclear what this means - but the organic groups set of modules is probably as close as you will get in Drupal with existing modules.

if not, then I agree with nanijoe.
